title: Glencore Sets Aside $1.5 Billion to Cover Regulatory Probes
sub_head: Commodities firm says it expects to resolve U.S., U.K. and Brazilian investigations into allegations of bribery this year
body:
LONDONâ€”Commodities giant Glencore PLC made a provision of $1.5 billion to cover a series of regulatory investigations in the U.S., the U.K. and Brazil into allegations of bribery, saying it expected the probes that have long bedeviled the company to be resolved this year.
In 2018, London-listed Glencore said it received a subpoena from the U.S. Department of Justice demanding records related to its compliance with American antibribery and money-laundering laws in Congo, Nigeria and Venezuela.
